Compound lists class

Source: R/compounds.R, R/compounds-cluster.R
compounds-class.Rd

Contains data of generated chemical compounds for given feature groups.

# S4 method for compounds
compoundTable(obj)

# S4 method for compounds
algorithm(obj)

# S4 method for compounds
groupNames(obj)

# S4 method for compounds
length(x)

# S4 method for compounds
show(object)

# S4 method for compounds,ANY,missing,missing
[(x, i, j, ..., drop = TRUE)

# S4 method for compounds,ANY,missing
[[(x, i, j)

# S4 method for compounds
$(x, name)

# S4 method for compounds
identifiers(compounds)

# S4 method for compounds
filter(obj, minExplainedPeaks = NULL,
  minScore = NULL, minFragScore = NULL, minFormulaScore = NULL,
  topMost = NULL)

# S4 method for compounds
addFormulaScoring(compounds, formConsensus,
  updateScore = FALSE, formulaScoreWeight = 1)

# S4 method for compounds
getMCS(obj, index, groupName)

# S4 method for compounds
plotStructure(obj, index, groupName, width = 500,
  height = 500, useGGPlot2 = FALSE)

# S4 method for compounds
plotScores(obj, index, groupName,
  normalizeScores = TRUE, useGGPlot2 = FALSE)

# S4 method for compounds
plotSpec(obj, index, groupName, MSPeakLists,
  formConsensus = NULL, plotStruct = TRUE, useGGPlot2 = FALSE)

# S4 method for compounds
consensus(obj, ..., compThreshold = 0,
  mergeScoresFunc = sum)

# S4 method for compoundsCluster,ANY,missing,missing
[(x, i, j, ...,
  drop = TRUE)

Arguments

obj, object, x, compounds

The compound object.
i

A numeric or character value which is used to select feature groups by their index or name, respectively (for the order/names see groupNames()).

For [: Can also be logical to perform logical selection (similar to regular vectors). If missing all feature groups are selected.

For [[: should be a skalar value.
…

compounds objects that should be used to generate the consensus.
drop, j

ignored.
name

The feature group name (partially matched).
minExplainedPeaks, minScore, minFragScore, minFormulaScore

Minimal number of explained peaks, overall score, in-silico fragmentation score and formula score, respectively. Set to NULL to ignore.
topMost

Only keep a maximum of topMost candidates with highest score. Set to NULL to ignore.
formConsensus

The formulaConsensus object that should be used for scoring/annotation. For plotSpec: set to NULL to ignore.
updateScore

If set to TRUE then the score column is updated by adding the normalized formulaScore (weighted by formulaScoreWeight). Currently, this only makes sense for MetFrag results!
formulaScoreWeight

Weight used to update scoring (see updateScore parameter).
index

The numeric index of the candidate structure. Multiple indices (i.e. vector with length >=2) may be specified for plotStructure and are mandatory for getMCS. Alternatively, -1 may be specified to these methods to select all candidates. When multiple indices are specified for plotStructure, their maximum common substructure will be drawn.
groupName

The name of the feature group to which the candidate belongs.
width, height

The dimensions (in pixels) of the raster image that should be plotted.
useGGPlot2

If TRUE then ggplot2 is used for plotting, otherwise base plot used. For plotSpec, ggplot2 allows nicely repelled text for annotation. However, base plot is generally faster.
normalizeScores

Normalize scores to maximum values.
MSPeakLists

The MSPeakLists object that was used to generate the candidate
plotStruct

If TRUE then the candidate structure is drawn in the spectrum.
compThreshold

Minimal fraction (0-1) that a candidate must be present within all given compounds objects.
mergeScoresFunc

Function used to calculate the total score for all (merged) score columns.

Value

plotSpec and plotStructure will return a ggplot object if useGGPlot2 is TRUE.

compoundTable returns a list containing for each feature group a data.table with an overview of all candidate compounds and other data such as candidate scoring, matched MS/MS fragments, etc.

filter returns a filtered compounds object.

addFormulaScoring returns a compounds object updated with formula scoring.

getMCS returns an rcdk molecule object (IAtomContainer).

consensus returns a compounds object that is produced by merging multiple specified compounds objects.

Details

compounds objects are obtained from compound generators.

Methods (by generic)

  • compoundTable: Accessor method to obtain generated compounds.

  • algorithm: Accessor method for the algorithm (a character string) used to generate compounds.

  • groupNames: returns a character vector with the names of the feature groups for which data is present in this object.

  • length: Obtain total number of candidate compounds.

  • show: Show summary information for this object.

  • [: Subset on feature groups.

  • [[: Extract a compound table for a feature group.

  • $: Extract a compound table for a feature group.

  • identifiers: Returns a list containing for each feature group a character vector with database identifiers for all candidate compounds. The list is named by feature group names, and is typically used with the identifiers option of generateCompoundsMetfrag.

  • filter: Provides rule based filtering for generated compounds. Useful to eliminate unlikely candidates and speed up further processing.

  • addFormulaScoring: Provides compound scoring data that is based on the presence of candidate formulae being present in a given formulaConsensus object. Matched precursor formulae yield one point, whereas matched MS/MS fragments yield 0.5 point each.

  • getMCS: Calculates the maximum common substructure (MCS) for two or more candidate structures for a feature group. This method uses the get.mcs function from rcdk.

  • plotStructure: Plots a structure of a candidate compound using the rcdk package. If multiple candidates are specified (i.e. by specifying a vector for index) then the maximum common substructure (MCS) of the selected candidates is drawn.

  • plotScores: Plots a barplot with scoring of a candidate compound.

  • plotSpec: Plots an annotated spectrum for a given candidate compound of a feature group.

  • consensus: Generates a consensus from multiple compounds objects. The compound results will be merged and optionally compounds will be filtered by their occurrence throughout the specified compounds objects.

  • [: Subset on feature groups.

Slots

compounds

Lists of all generated compounds. Use the compounds method for access.

algorithm

The algorithm that was used for generation of compounds. Use the algorithm method for access.

References

Guha, R. (2007). 'Chemical Informatics Functionality in R'. Journal of Statistical Software 6(18)
